Kasus PLTU Riau-1, Mantan Dirut PT PLN Sofyan Basir Divonis Bebas
04 Nov 2019, 06:46 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR).- Direktur Utama PT PLN (Persero) 2016—2018 Sofyan Basir divonis bebas dari semua dakwaan jaksa penuntut umum KPK dalam perkara dugaan pembantuan kesepakatan proyek Pembangkit Listrik Tenaga Uap Mulut Tambang Riau-1 (PLTU MT Riau-1).
"Mengadili menyatakan terdakwa Sofyan Basir tidak terbukti secara sah dan meyakinkan sebagaimana dakwaan pertama dan kedua jaksa penuntut umum," kata majelis hakim yang diketuai Hariono di Pengadilan Tindak Pidana Korupsi (Tipikor) Jakarta, Senin, 4 November 2019, seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara.
Dalam perkara ini, jaksa penuntut umum (JPU) KPK meminta Sofyan divonis 5 tahun penjara ditambah denda Rp 200 juta subsider 3 bulan kurungan karena dinilai melakukan pembantuan fasilitasi suap terkait kesepakatan proyek Independent Power Producer (IPP) PLTU MT Riau-1, yaitu memfasilitasi pertemuan antara anggota Komisi VII DPR Eni Maulani Saragih, politikus Partai Golkar Idrus Marham dan pengusaha Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo.
Sofyan dinilai tidak terbukti melakukan perbuatan sebagaimana dakwaan pertama maupun kedua dari Pasal 12 Huruf a dan Pasal 11 Undang-Undang Nomor 31 Tahun 1999  tentang Pemberantasan Tindak Pidana Korupsi juncto Pasal 56 Ayat (2) KUHP sebagaimana diubah UU No. 20/2001.
Seperti dilansir Kantor Berita Antara, sejumlah perbuatan yang tidak terbukti menurut majelis hakim yang terdiri atas Hariono, Hastoko, Saifuddin Zuhri, Anwar, dan Ugo tersebut adalah:
Pertama, Sofyan dinilai tidak terbukti mengetahui kesepakatan penerimaan fee yang akan diterima oleh pemegang saham Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd. Johannes Budisutrinso Kotjo dari CHEC Ltd. sebesar 2,5 persen atau sejumlah 25 juta dolar AS yang akan diberikan kepada sejumlah pihak.
Sesuai dengan keterangan Setya Novanto yang tidak tahu catatan tersebut, sedangkan Sofyan yang menandatangani perjanjian IPP PLTU MT Riau-1 antara PT Pembangkitan Jawa Bali Investasi (PJBI) dan Blackgold Natural Resources Limited (BNR) Ltd. dan China Huadian Engineering Company Limited (CHEC,Ltd.) tidak tercantum atau bukan sebagai pihak yang menerima fee.
"Maka, terdakwa Sofyan tidak memahami dan tidak tahu fee yang akan diterima Johannes Kotjo dan tidak tahu kepada siapa saja akan diberikan," kata anggota majelis hakim Anwar.
Kedua, terkait penerimaan Eni Maulani Saragih selaku anggota Komisi VII DPR RI 2014—2019 dan Idrus Marham uang secara bertahap seluruhnya berjumlah Rp4,75 miliar dari Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo juga dinilai hakim tidak diketahui Sofyan.
"Sesuai dengan keterangan Eni Maulani Saragih bahwa uang dari Johannes Kotjo tersebut bahwa terdakwa Sofyan sama sekali tidak tahu," kata hakim Anwar.
Ketiga, tindakan Sofyan selaku Dirut PLN yang telah menandatangani kesepakatan IPP PLTU MT Riau-1 antara PJBI, BNR, dan CHEC bukan karena keinginan Sofyan.



Hakim Anwar mengatakan bahwa penandatangan itu bukanlah keinginan Sofyan maupun Eni dan Johannes Kotjo dan PT PLN Persero memiliki saham 51 persen tanpa membebani keuangan PT PLN.
Terkait dengan penerimaan uang dari Johanes Kotjo secara bertahap Rp4,75 miliar adalah tanpa sepengetahuan terdakwa Sofyan Basir dan tidak ada kaitannya dengan proyek PLTU MT Riau-1 karena sudah sesuai dengan ketentuan presiden tentang infrakstruktur dan ketenagalistgrikan, sesuai dengan keterangan Eni dan Kotjo bahwa Sofyan tidak tahu penerimaan uang.
"Menimbang dengan demikan terdakwa Sofyan Basir tidak terbukti melakukan perbantuan dakwaan pertama Pasal 12 Huruf a UU No. 31/1999 sebagaimana diubah UU No. 20/2001 juncto Pasal 56 Ayat (2) KUHP, " kata hakim Anwar yang disambut dengan suara tepuk tangan para pendukung Sofyan yang memenuhi ruangan sidang.
Hakim Anwar melanjutkan, "Karena terdakwa tidak terbukti secarah sah dan meyakinkan bersalah melakukan tindak pidana perbantuan sebagaimana dakwaan pertama maka majelis hakim akan mempertimbangkan dakwaan kedua, yaitu perbuatan Pasal 11."
Dakwaan kedua dari Pasal 11 UU No. 31/1999 sebagaimana diubah UU No. 20/2001 jo. Pasal 56 Ayat (2) KUHP juga dinilai tidak terbukti.
"Karena terdakwa Sofyan Basir tidak terbukti melakukan perbuatan perbantuan, terdakwa Sofyan Basir juga tidak terbukti melakukan tindak pidana perbantuan sebagaimana dakwaan kedua, terdakwa harus dibebaskan dari segala dakwaan," ungkap hakim Anwar.
Karena Sofyan dibebaskan dari segala tuntutan, hakim pun memerintahkan Sofyan untuk dibebaskan dan membuka seluruh blokir rekeningnnya.
"Karena terdakwa dibebaskan dari dakwaan, terdakwa harus dipulihkan semua harkat dan martabatnya. Majelis memerintahkan untuk dibebaskan dari tahanan segera setelah putusan disahkan," kata hakim Hastoko.
Terhadap pemblokiran rekening Sofyan Basir, keluarga dan pihak terkait lain karena terdakwa tidak terbukti melakukan tindak pidana perbantuan, diperintahkan untuk membuka blokir sebagaimana dimohonkan penasihat hukum terdakwa .
Atas putusan tersebut, Sofyan Basir menyatakan menerima, sementara JPU KPK menyatakan pikir-pikir.
"Kami menghormati putusan dan kami mengajukan pikir-pikir selama 7 hari. Akan tetapi, karena kami tidak ada persiapan (untuk membebaskan), kami mohon waktu untuk melaksanakan," kata JPU KPK Lie Putra Setiawan.***

Case of PLTU Riau-1, Former Managing Director of PT PLN Sofyan Basir Sentenced Free
Nov 04 2019, 06:46 by Siska Nirmala
JAKARTA, (PR) .- President Director of PT PLN (Persero) 2016-2018 Sofyan Basir was convicted of all charges of the KPK's public prosecutor in the alleged case of assisting an agreement on the Riau Mine-1 Steam Mouth Power Plant project (PLTU MT Riau-1) .
"Prosecuting stated that the defendant Sofyan Basir was not legally and convincingly proven as the first and second charges of the public prosecutor," said the panel of judges chaired by Hariono in the Corruption Court (Tipikor) Jakarta, Monday, November 4, 2019, as reported by the Antara News Agency.
In this case, the KPK prosecutor asked Sofyan to be sentenced to 5 years in prison plus a fine of Rp 200 million in 3 months imprisonment because he was considered to assist in facilitating bribery related to the Independent Power Producer (IPP) MT Riau-1 PLTU project agreement, which facilitated a meeting between House Commission VII member Eni Maulani Saragih, Golkar Party politician Idrus Marham and businessman Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo.
Sofyan was deemed not proven to have committed the acts as the first or second indictment of Article 12 Letter a and Article 11 of Law Number 31 of 1999 concerning Eradication of Corruption in conjunction with Article 56 Paragraph (2) of the Criminal Code as amended by Law No. 20/2001.
As reported by Antara News Agency, a number of acts which were not proven according to the panel of judges consisting of Hariono, Hastoko, Saifuddin Zuhri, Anwar, and Ugo were:
First, Sofyan was judged not proven to know the agreement to receive a fee to be received by Blackgold Natural Resources Ltd. shareholders. Johannes Budisutrinso Kotjo from CHEC Ltd. 2.5 percent or 25 million US dollars to be given to a number of parties.
In accordance with the statement of Setya Novanto who did not know the notes, while Sofyan who signed the IPP MT Riau-1 IPP agreement between PT Generating Java Bali Investment (PJBI) and Blackgold Natural Resources Limited (BNR) Ltd. and China Huadian Engineering Company Limited (CHEC, Ltd.) is not listed or not as the party receiving the fee.
"So, the defendant Sofyan does not understand and does not know the fee that Johannes Kotjo will receive and does not know who will be given it," said panel member Anwar.
Second, related to the receipt of Eni Maulani Saragih as a member of the House of Representatives Commission VII 2014-2019 and Idrus Marham, the total amount of Rp4.75 billion from Johannes Budisutrisno Kotjo was also assessed by judges as unknown by Sofyan.
"In accordance with Eni Maulani Saragih's statement that the money from Johannes Kotjo is that the defendant Sofyan did not know at all," judge Anwar said.
Third, Sofyan's actions as Managing Director of PLN that has signed an IP Riau MTP IPP agreement between PJBI, BNR, and CHEC were not due to Sofyan's wishes.



Judge Anwar said that the signing was not the desire of Sofyan and Eni and Johannes Kotjo and PT PLN Persero to have a 51 percent stake without burdening PT PLN's finances.
Regarding the gradual receipt of money from Johanes Kotjo, Rp4.75 billion was without the knowledge of Defendant Sofyan Basir and there was no connection with the PLTU MT Riau-1 project because it was in accordance with the president's provisions regarding infrastructure and electricity, in accordance with Eni and Kotjo's statement that Sofyan was not know the receipt of money.
"Considering that the defendant Sofyan Basir was not proven to have assisted the first indictment of Article 12 Letter a of Law No. 31/1999 as amended by Law No. 20/2001 in conjunction with Article 56 Paragraph (2) of the Criminal Code," said judge Anwar who was greeted with applause Sofyan supporters who filled the courtroom.
Judge Anwar continued, "Because the defendant was not proven to be as legitimate and convincingly guilty of committing a criminal act of assistance as the first indictment, the panel of judges will consider the second indictment, namely the act of Article 11."
The second indictment of Article 11 of Law No. 31/1999 as amended by Law No. 20/201 jo. Article 56 Paragraph (2) of the Indonesian Criminal Code is also deemed unproven.
"Because Defendant Sofyan Basir was not proven to have committed acts of assistance, Defendant Sofyan Basir was also not proven to have committed criminal acts of assistance as the second indictment, the defendant must be acquitted of all charges," Judge Anwar said.
Because Sofyan was acquitted of all charges, the judge also ordered Sofyan to be released and opened the entire account block.
"Because the defendant is acquitted of the indictment, the defendant must recover all his dignity and status. The court ordered to be released from detention as soon as the verdict was ratified," judge Hastoko said.
Against the blocking of Sofyan Basir's account, his family and other related parties because the defendant was not proven to have committed a criminal act of assistance, were ordered to unblock as requested by the defendant's legal counsel.
Upon this decision, Sofyan Basir said he accepted, while the KPK prosecutor expressed his thoughts.
"We respect the decision and we put forward our thoughts for 7 days. However, because we have no preparation (to release), we ask for time to carry out," said KPK Prosecutor Lie Putra Setiawan. ***
